CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of L2 cache read lookups performed.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every L2 cache read lookup made.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of internal L2 cache reads that result in an external read.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the percentage of internal L2 cache reads that result in an external read.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of L2 cache write lookups performed.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every L2 cache write lookup made.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of internal L2 cache writes that result in an external write.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the percentage of internal L2 cache writes that result in an external write.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of external read transactions.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every external read transaction made on the memory bus. These transactions typically result in an external DRAM access, but some designs include a system cache which can provide some buffering.
The longest memory transaction possible is 64 bytes in length, but shorter transactions are generated in some circumstances.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of external write transactions.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every external write transaction made on the memory bus. These transactions typically result in an external DRAM access, but some chips include a system cache which can provide some buffering.
The longest memory transaction possible is 64 bytes in length, but shorter transactions are generated in some circumstances.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of external bus data read cycles.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when a data beat was read from the external memory bus.
Most implementations use a 128-bit (16-byte) data bus, enabling a single 64-byte read transaction to be read using 4 bus cycles.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The total output read bandwidth for the GPU.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the total output read bandwidth for the GPU.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The total output read bandwidth for the GPU.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the total output read bandwidth for the GPU, measured in bytes per second.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of external bus data write cycles.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every clock cycle when a data beat was written to the external memory bus.
Most implementations use a 128-bit (16-byte) data bus, enabling a single 64-byte read transaction to be written using 4 bus cycles.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The total output write bandwidth for the GPU.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the total output write bandwidth for the GPU.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The total output write bandwidth for the GPU.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the total output write bandwidth for the GPU, measured in bytes per second.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when a read is stalled waiting for the external bus.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every stall cycle on the AXI bus where the GPU has a valid read transaction to send, but is awaiting a ready signal from the bus.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of cycles with an external read transaction stalled.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of GPU cycles with a memory stall on an external read transaction.
Stall rates can be reduced by reducing the size of data resources, such as buffers or textures.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when a write is stalled waiting for the external bus.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every stall cycle on the external bus where the GPU has a valid write transaction to send, but is awaiting a ready signal from the external bus.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of cycles with an external write transaction stalled.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of GPU cycles with a memory stall on an external write transaction.
Stall rates can be reduced by reducing geometry complexity, or the size of framebuffers in memory.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of data beats returned 0-127 cycles after the read request.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every data beat that is returned between 0 and 127 cycles after the read transaction started. This latency is considered a fast access response speed.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of data beats returned 128-191 cycles after the read request.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every data beat that is returned between 128 and 191 cycles after the read transaction started. This latency is considered a normal access response speed.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of data beats returned 192-255 cycles after the read request.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every data beat that is returned between 192 and 255 cycles after the read transaction started. This latency is considered a normal access response speed.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of data beats returned 256-319 cycles after the read request.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every data beat that is returned between 256 and 319 cycles after the read transaction started. This latency is considered a slow access response speed.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of data beats returned 320-383 cycles after the read request.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every data beat that is returned between 320 and 383 cycles after the read transaction started. This latency is considered a slow access response speed.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of read beats that are returned at least 384 cycles after the transaction started.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression increments for every read beat that is returned at least 384 cycles after the transaction started. This latency is considered a very slow access response speed.
CounterInfo.Equation: MaliExtBusRdBt - MaliExtBusRdLat0 - MaliExtBusRdLat128 - MaliExtBusRdLat192 - MaliExtBusRdLat256 - MaliExtBusRdLat320

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of read transactions initiated when 0-25% of the maximum are in use.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every read transaction initiated when 0-25% of the available transaction IDs are in use.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of read transactions initiated when 25-50% of the maximum are in use.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every read transaction initiated when 25-50% of the available transaction IDs are in use.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of read transactions initiated when 50-75% of the maximum are in use.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every read transaction initiated when 50-75% of the available transaction IDs are in use.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of read transactions initiated when 75-100% of transaction IDs are in use.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression increments for every read transaction initiated when 75-100% of transaction IDs are in use.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of write transactions initiated when 0-25% of the maximum are in use.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every write transaction initiated when 0-25% of the available transaction IDs are in use.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of write transactions initiated when 25-50% of the maximum are in use.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every write transaction initiated when 25-50% of the available transaction IDs are in use.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of write transactions initiated when 50-75% of the maximum are in use.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every write transaction initiated when 50-75% of the available transaction IDs are in use.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of write transactions initiated when 75-100% of transaction IDs are in use.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression increments for every write transaction initiated when 75-100% of transaction IDs are in use.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of main MMU address translations performed.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every address lookup made by the main GPU MMU. Increments only occur if all lookups into a local TLB miss.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of L2 cache read requests from internal requesters.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every read request received by the L2 cache from an internal requester.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of L2 cache line evict requests from internal requesters.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every line evict request received by the L2 cache from an internal requester.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of L2 cache line clean unique requests from internal requesters.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every line clean unique request received by the L2 cache from an internal requester.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles L2 cache read requests from internal requesters are stalled.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle an L2 cache read request from an internal requester is stalled.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of L2 cache write requests from internal requesters.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every write request received by the L2 cache from an internal requester.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when L2 cache write requests from internal requesters are stalled.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle when an L2 cache write request from an internal requester is stalled.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of L2 snoop requests from internal requesters.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every coherency snoop request received by the L2 cache from internal requesters.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when L2 cache snoop requests from internal requesters are stalled.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle when an L2 cache coherency snoop request from an internal requester is stalled.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of L1 cache read requests sent by the L2 cache to an internal requester.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every L1 cache read request or read response sent by the L2 cache to an internal requester.
Read requests are triggered by a snoop request from one requester that needs data from another requester's L1 to resolve.
Read responses are standard responses back to a requester in response to its own read requests.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when L1 cache read requests sent by the L2 cache to an internal requester are stalled.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle when L1 cache read requests and responses sent by the L2 cache to an internal requester are stalled.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of L1 cache write responses sent by the L2 cache to an internal requester.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every L1 cache write response sent by the L2 cache to an internal requester.
Write responses are standard responses back to a requester in response to its own write requests.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of L2 cache lookups performed.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every L2 cache lookup made, including all reads, writes, coherency snoops, and cache flush operations.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of coherency snoop lookups performed that were triggered by an external requester.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every coherency snoop lookup performed that is triggered by a requester outside of the GPU.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of external non-coherent read transactions.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every non-coherent (ReadNoSnp) transaction.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of external coherent read unique transactions.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every coherent exclusive read (ReadUnique) transaction.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of external non-coherent full write transactions.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every external non-coherent full write (WriteNoSnpFull) transaction.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of external non-coherent partial write transactions.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every external non-coherent partial write (WriteNoSnpPtl) transaction.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of external coherent full write transactions.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every external coherent full write (WriteBackFull or WriteUniqueFull) transaction.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of external coherent partial write transactions.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every external coherent partial write (WriteBackPtl or WriteUniquePtl) transaction.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of coherency snoops triggered by external requesters.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every coherency snoop transaction received from an external requester.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when a coherency snoop triggered by external requester is stalled.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every clock cycle when a coherency snoop transaction received from an external requester is stalled by the L2 cache.
